result.execSummary:
The defendant Dylan N Borgen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  You have been ordered to have to provide a DNA sample as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Defendant Dylan N Borgen in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Dylan N Borgen in custody.  Brian Van Schyndel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.
